name: Cybermark International
description: I worked here for about 3 months. During those months I learned a lot of the basic skills I would then apply to future projects. I never produced my own projects here, but I learned a lot about Regex, CSS, PHP, SQL, SEO and a lot more!

name: BX3 Interactive
description: For over a year I worked tirelessly creating and editing websites using custom CMS's built on PHP and SQL databases. It was a small company and we all wore many different hats throughout the development project. It wasn't unexpected for me to help with designing, talking to customers, build a database structure or create entirely new projects on my own. I parted ways on good terms with them to get back on the eastern coast of the United States.

name: D3Corp
description: Working here was one of the best experiences in my work career so far. I learned a lot about git and so many other development processes. I wore a lot of hats here as well, ranging from SEO specialist to main developer. Work was always fast and forethcoming and I was always kept busy. The team was comfortable and friendly and we all got along rather well.

name: Suffolk County Community College
description: My first college experience, where I learned design skills that has given me a keen eye on color composition, spacing and more. I also got into programming here first, with computer math and basic flash programming.

name: Rochester Institute of Technology
description: I loved this university. The diversity in students coupled with the care and attention from the professors truly shined through. I learned so much about programming and development here and it kicked off my career into web development.
